meanings.definition: Be deprived of or cease to have possession of (something).
meanings.sent2: She will lose her keys if she doesn't remember where she put them.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin disappear, causing the audience to lose sight of it.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, sometimes we lose precious moments that we can never get back.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of losing a cherished possession can be heartbreaking.

meanings.definition: Fail to win (a game or contest).
meanings.sent1: The team may lose the match if they don't play well.
meanings.sent2: He tends to lose at chess against his older brother.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he continued to lose every round of the competition.
meanings.sent4: Losing a game can teach valuable lessons about sportsmanship and perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The athlete felt disappointed after losing the race by a small margin.

meanings.definition: Be unable to find (something or someone).
meanings.sent1: I always lose my socks in the laundry.
meanings.sent2: She tends to lose her phone in the house and then finds it in unexpected places.
meanings.sent3: The detective pretended to lose the suspect in the crowd to catch them off guard.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes we lose ourselves in the chaos of life, only to rediscover our path later.
meanings.sent5: Losing a pet can be a distressing experience for the whole family.
